page.title: 09BRECHIN'S SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: Brechin has a typical selection of {Market Town}food shops , mostly on {High St.,Swan St. and St. David St. Some difficulties arise when unloading goods, due to the narrowness of the streets, and some shops have limited storage space. Staff work quite long hours but openings exist in most shops for smart, pleasant, young people willing to learn. Most shoppers(86%) who buy their foodstuffs in Brechin prefer the supermarkets (Finfare, Co-op, Galbraith's) where they can browse and buy items at cheaper prices. However, 14% still prefer the friendlier, quieter atmosphere of the traditional grocer shops such as Adam's. When asked their opinion concerning the possible creation of a {pedestrian precinct}in the town centre over 70% of the sample were in favour, saying that it would be safer.
